title: Justin Bieber teases album release before Christmas
text:
Justin’s new album could arrive just in time for Christmas (Picture: GC Images)

Justin Bieber might just deliver fans an early Christmas present as he’s promised to release his anticipated new album before the year is out.

The What Do You Mean? singer spent the weekend teasing his new music and finally offered fans the chance to hear his new material sooner than expected.

Biebs shared an Instagram post on Sunday which said: ‘If this gets 20 million likes Justin Bieber will release an album before Christmas [sic].’

In the caption, the popstar added: ‘Share it, like it, post in your story, I gotta see the demand ;) love you guys pumped for it! I’m almost done but your support will make me move faster.’

So far, the post has been liked almost 4.6 million times while the likes of Cruz Beckham, DJ Khaled and Logan Paul have showed support by sharing the photo in their Instagram Stories.

Come on Beliebers, get double tapping if you want that new music. With 120 million followers, it shouldn’t be too hard a task.

Prior to the announcement, Justin, 25, hinted at the direction of his new music by writing ‘R&Bieber’ in an Instagram post.

Some fans are also convinced the title of the album could be Yummy Yummy after Justin shared a handwritten note with the phrase and an apple with the caption: ‘Bonafide stallion, ain’t in no Stable no you stay on the run [sic],’ hinting at song lyrics.

It’s been four long years since Justin blessed us with his last album, Purpose, which symbolised his redemption and put him back in the world’s good graces after a string of bad boy behaviour in the previous years.

Purpose reached number one in multiple countries, including the US and UK, and boasted the hit singles Sorry, What Do You Mean?, Where Are U Now and Love Yourself.

News of Justin’s possible new music comes after his ex-girlfriend Selena Gomez dropped her brand new single. Fans believe Selena, 27, throws shade at Justin and his new wife Hailey Baldwin with lyrics about being ‘replaced’ in two months ‘like it was easy’. She also shades an ex for ‘singing off-key’.
